com.github.dm.jrt.proxy.annotation

Annotation Type Proxy


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface Proxy
    This annotation is used to indicate interfaces used as templates to generate proxy classes enabling asynchronous calls of the target instance methods.
    The target class is specified in the annotation value. A proxy class implementing the annotated interface will be generated according to the specific annotation attributes.

    The routines used for calling the methods will honor the attributes specified in any optional com.github.dm.jrt.annotation.* annotations defined for each interface method.

    Special care must be taken when dealing with proxies of generic classes. First of all, the proxy interface must declare the same generic types as the wrapped class or interface. Additionally, the generic parameters must be declared as Object in order for the proxy interface methods to match the target ones.
    Be also aware that it is responsibility of the caller to ensure that the same instance is not wrapped around two different generic interfaces.
    For example, a class of the type: 

         

             public class MyList<TYPE> {

                 private final ArrayList<TYPE> mList = new ArrayList<TYPE>();

                 public void add(final TYPE element) {

                     mList.add(element);
                 }

                 public TYPE get(final int i) {

                     return mList.get(i);
                 }
             }
    can be correctly wrapped by an interface of the type: 
         

             @Proxy(MyList.class)
             public interface MyListAsync<TYPE> {

                 void add(Object element);

                 TYPE get(int i);

                 @Alias("get")
                 @Output
                 OutputChannel<TYPE> getAsync(int i);

                 @Alias("get")
                 @Output(OutputMode.COLLECTION)
                 List<TYPE> getList(int i);
             }

    Remember also that, in order for the annotation to properly work at run time, you will need to add the following rules to your Proguard file (if employing it for shrinking or obfuscation): 

         

         -keepattributes RuntimeVisibleAnnotations

         -keepclassmembers class ** {
              @com.github.dm.jrt.proxy.annotation.Proxy *;
         }
    Be sure also to include a proper rule in your Proguard file, so to keep the name of all the classes implementing the specific mirror interface, like, for example: 
         

         -keep public class * extends my.mirror.Interface {
              public <init>;
         }

    Created by davide-maestroni on 11/03/2014.

    See Also:
    Alias, CoreInstances, Input, InputMaxSize, InputOrder, Inputs, InputTimeout, MaxInstances, Invoke, Output, OutputMaxSize, OutputOrder, OutputTimeout, Priority, ReadTimeout, ReadTimeoutAction, SharedFields

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      Class<?> value
      The wrapped class.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String className
      The generated class name.
      String classPackage
      The generated class package.
      String classPrefix
      The generated class name prefix.
      String classSuffix
      The generated class name suffix.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract Class<?> value
        The wrapped class.
        Returns:
        the class.

      • className

        public abstract String className
        The generated class name. By default the name is obtained by the interface simple name, prepending all the outer class names in case it is not a top level class.

        For instance, an interface named MyItf defined inside a class named MyClass, will result in the generation of a class named Proxy_MyClass_MyItf.

        Returns:
        the class name.
        Default:
        "*"

      • classPackage

        public abstract String classPackage
        The generated class package. By default it is the same as the interface one.
        Returns:
        the package.
        Default:
        "*"

      • classPrefix

        public abstract String classPrefix
        The generated class name prefix.
        Returns:
        the name prefix.
        Default:
        "Proxy_"

      • classSuffix

        public abstract String classSuffix
        The generated class name suffix.
        Returns:
        the name suffix.
        Default:
        ""
